books.author: by Mary L. Trump
books.description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.
books.name: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH

books.author: by Alex Trebek
books.description: Who is the Canadian-American who got his break on American TV by hosting the game show “The Wizard of Odds” and whose pronunciation of the word “genre” has been shared widely on social media?
books.name: THE ANSWER IS ...

books.author: by Robin DiAngelo
books.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.
books.name: WHITE FRAGILITY

books.author: by Ben Shapiro
books.description: The conservative commentator describes what he perceives as threats to American history, ideals and culture.
books.name: HOW TO DESTROY AMERICA IN THREE EASY STEPS

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by John Bolton
books.description: The former national security advisor gives his account of the 17 months he spent working for President Trump.
books.name: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Timothy Snyder
books.description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.
books.name: ON TYRANNY

books.author: by Eddie S. Glaude Jr.
books.description: An appraisal of the life and work of James Baldwin and their meaning in relation to the Black Lives Matter movement and the Trump presidency.
books.name: BEGIN AGAIN

books.author: by Ijeoma Oluo
books.description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.
books.name: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE

books.author: by Anne Applebaum
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning historian looks at the rise of nationalism and authoritarianism around the world.
books.name: TWILIGHT OF DEMOCRACY

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.
books.name: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by John Lewis and Michael D'Orso
books.description: A memoir by the recently deceased leader in the American civil rights movement and representative for Georgia’s Fifth Congressional District.
books.name: WALKING WITH THE WIND

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: Winner of the 2016 National Book Award for nonfiction. A look at anti-Black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history.
books.name: STAMPED FROM THE BEGINNING
